data.title: James "Jim" Cronin Obituary - Seaforth, Ontario
data.meta_description: It is with heavy hearts, we mourn the passing of James Daniel Cronin on Tuesday, October 4, 2016.  Jim passed peacefully at his home surrounded by the love of his family, at the age of 72.  The world is a little less bright for those of us who knew and loved him.  He was truly a good man.  Jim was kind and thoughtful, full of laughter and ready to help out in a moment’s notice.  He was a quiet man with integrity, whose word was his bond.  His passion was farming, especially his cattle.    He was born December 23, 1943 in Seaforth, Ontario, to Albert & Eileen (Eckert) Cronin.  Jim was a loving husband to his wife Karen (Pletch) for 47 years.  Treasured father of Lori Parsons (Paul), Julie Hoekstra (Dwayne), Michelle Jeffery (Stu), Gary Cronin (Lindsay) and Kari Cronin Soleski (Mark).  Proud Grandpa & Papa of Steve, Scott, Jason, Luke, Logan, Blake, Kirsten, Erika, Kaitlyn, Eloise, James and baby Soleski due in January.  Beloved brother and brother-in-law of Mary Smith, Steve & Nancy Cronin, Jerry & Heather Cronin, Joanne Regier, Don & Connie Pletch, Steve & Barb Pletch & Jim Hogan.  Son-in-law of Edna Pletch.  He was predeceased by his father-in-law Tom Pletch, brothers-in-laws Leo Smith, Dave Regier and sister-in-law Bonnie Hogan.  Jim will be sorely missed by his family, friends and community.   Visitation will be held at McGlynn Family Funeral Home, 87 Goderich St. W., Seaforth, 519-527-1390, on Friday, October 7th from 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. (with Parish Prayers at 1:45 p.m. Friday).  Funeral Mass of Christian Burial led by Fr. Raju Allumpurath will be held at St. James Catholic Church, 22 Victoria St., Seaforth, on Saturday, October 8th at 10:30 a.m.  Interment will take place in St. Columban Catholic Cemetery followed by a reception at the Seaforth & District Community Centre.  As expressions of sympathy, memorial donations may be made to the Seaforth Community Hospital Foundation, St. Columban Cemetery Fund or a charity of one’s choice through the funeral home.  Online condolences and donations can be made by visiting Jim’s memorial at www.mcglynnfamilyfuneralhome.com
data.text:
Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.
